snippet.title: Where's My Water 2 for iOS
snippet.description: Where's My Water 2 is a fun sequel that is sadly overshadowed by a brutal freemium model that makes it impossible for me to recommend it to anyone.

snippet.title: 'Lab on a phone' detects mercury in water
snippet.description: Researchers at UCLA are using a 3D printer to produce an inexpensive, lightweight smartphone attachment that could ultimately take the place of large, expensive lab equipment.

snippet.title: NASA photos show possible flowing water on Mars
snippet.description: They're called "recurring slope lineae." They've been showing up in photos of Mars, and they could be explained by the presence of seasonal water flows on the red planet.

snippet.title: Obama: We're building Iron Man
snippet.description: With so much going on, you might have missed it this week. But President Obama revealed details of this secret project and promised to "blast off" himself.

snippet.title: Cobra AirWave Box
snippet.description: With their extra-durable design, Cobra's AirWave Box and Mini speakers enable you to brave the elements at your next impromptu dance party.

snippet.title: Iron Man superhero mashups look supercool
snippet.description: The Iron Mash digital art series gives Iron Man gear to superheroes like Batman, Wolverine, and Spider-Man. Imagine the possibilities.

snippet.title: Google Nexus 7 (summer 2013)
snippet.description: Thanks to its stellar performance and affordable price, the Nexus 7 is the Android tablet to get.

snippet.title: 'Iron Man' on steroids: Step into a working 'Appleseed' Mecha
snippet.description: A working, wearable Japanese exoskeleton gets bulked up, thanks to some inspiration from a popular manga series.

snippet.title: 'Iron Man' Robert Downey Jr. back with HTC One M8 spot
snippet.description: It's back to basics as the actor talks up HTC's new flagship smartphone.

snippet.title: DryWired
snippet.description: New nanotechnology from DryWired promises to seal up phones and tablets, guarding them from liquid harm.
